page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The area is almost totally open country with villages to be found on the very edge, but with their centres into adjoining areas. The only settlement that can be said to be truely within this area is Curdridge, but this is a relatively dispersed settlement with no village centre as such. Apart from Curdridge, the rest of the area is virtually all agricultural, though with an interesting pattern to its distribution, dividing into 3 types: 1. In the S.W. is an area of Market Gardening 2. The central area is mixed arable and livestock farming 3. The western portion comprises small holdings and dairy farming.
